newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Jan 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Jan 9.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina on Wednesday said the proposed four-nation sub-regional grouping was aimed at boosting trade, and would help strengthen the SAARC.

Opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chief Begum Khaleda Zia said India would ultimately turn three other members of the proiposed sub-regional group -- Bangladesh, Nepal and Bhutan -- into provinces.
The country's police force will have a dog-squad soon for tracking down fleeing offenders and hidden drugs, Home Minister Rafiqul Islam said on Wednesday.
Bangladesh and Myanmar have agreed to end the repatriation of Burmese Rohingya refugees by March.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina dismissed as nonsense the "evil" propaganda that the ruling Awami League would not strengthen the army.
Myanmar border security force intruded into Bangladesh territorial waters Tuesday night and fired at random on a fishing boat, injuring five fishermen, four of them still missing.

Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Farooq Sobhan on Wednesday defended the proposed sub-regional grouping between Bagladesh, India, Nepal and Bhutan, saying it was not going to be formed at the expense of SAARC.
Cargho handling at the Chittagong port dropped by 12.17 percent in 1996 over the previous year.
